column1: The test will show how well the blood is pumping through different parts of the heart.
If one part of the heart is moving poorly while the others move well, it may mean that there has been damage to that part of the heart.

Abnormal results may be due to: - Blockages in the coronary arteries (coronary artery disease) - Heart valve disease - Other cardiac disorders that weaken the heart - Past heart attack (myocardial infarction) - Poor pumping function The test may also be performed for: - Atrial septal defect - Dilated cardiomyopathy - Heart failure - Idiopathic cardiomyopathy - Peripartum cardiomyopathy - Senile cardiac amyloid - Testing whether a medicine has affected heart function
